qas.question: How many players does each side field in an American football game?
What is the term for the team who begins a play with control of the ball?
What is the initial backward movement of the ball in a play called?
Which two players most commonly receive the first backward pass in a football play?
What is the term for a team with control of the quarterback?
What is the defence of the ball in play called?
Name a player that commonly receives the first possession of the ball?
How many possessions does each team have in an American game?
What is the running back in possession of the ball called?

context: On the field at the beginning of a play are two teams of 12 (unlike <a0_0><b7_0>11<b7_0/><a0_0/> in American football). The team in possession of the ball is <b8_0>the <a1_0><b4_0>offence<b8_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/> and the team defending is referred to as the defence. Play begins with a backwards pass through the legs (<a2_0><b5_0>the snap<b5_0/><a2_0/>) by a member of the offensive team, to another member of the offensive team. This is <b6_0>usually the <a3_0>quarterback or punter<b6_0/><a3_0/>, but a "direct snap" to a running back is also not uncommon. If the quarterback or punter receives the ball, he may then do any of the following:
